description: Allows automating airplane tickets booking on airline websites and OTAs.

url.description: Website entry point. Should be a deep link to either flight page or flight selection page.

account.description:
Account information for filling in contact details.
Receipts and booking references will typically be sent to specified email.
Some websites also require registering user account, in which case password must be provided.

selectedOutboundFare.description:
Requested when fare selection for outbound flight is required by website.
At this point availableOutboundFares output should contain information about available fares.
Note: on deep links with pre-selected flight this input is not required.
Automation may fail if incorrect fare is specified, or if fare is no longer available.

selectedInboundFare.description:
Requested when fare selection for inbound flight is required by website.
At this point availableInboundFares output should contain information about available fares.
Note: on deep links with pre-selected flight this input is not required.
Automation may fail if incorrect fare is specified, or if fare is no longer available.

finalPriceConsent.description:
Client's consent for final price, should exactly match the finalPrice object from output.
Automation will not proceed with placing order until the consent is provided.

availableOutboundFares.description:
Emitted when actual outbound fares information is collected.
Note: on deep links with pre-selected flight this output will not be provided.

availableInboundFares.description:
Emitted when actual inbound fares information is collected.
Note: on deep links with pre-selected flight this output will not be provided.

finalPrice.description:
Emitted immediately before placing order, when final price is available.
Automation will request finalPriceConsent input which should match this object.

Options.description: Flags for enabling optional automation features like seat selection. Clients should send false or omit flags if specific features are not implemented on their end.

seatSelection.description: If true, automation will request selectedSeatIds for seat selection.

Itinerary.description: Information about flights and cabin class preference.

cabinClass.description: Preferred cabin class, used on flight search forms.

inbound.description: Inbound (return) flight specification. If omitted, one-way flight booking flow is used.

dateTime.description: Date and time of flight (airport local time).

airportCode.description: International Air Transport Association airport code.

Passengers.description: An array with details for each passenger.

firstName.description: First name(s) or given name(s), as specified in ID.

middleName.description:
Middle name, if applicable.
This will only be used on websites which provide separate entry for middle names, otherwise it will be ignored.
If middle name is essential for placing order, consider appending it to firstName.

lastName.description: Last name or surname, as specified in ID.

dateOfBirth.description: Passenger's date of birth in YYYY-MM-DD format. Example: 1976-01-21.

PassengerId.description: Passenger ID (passport or other travel document).

AvailableFares.description: A list of available fares found on the website.

fareName.description: Fare marketing name as provided by airline. Example: Business Flex.

SelectedSeats.description:
An array with seat selection stages. Each stage corresponds to a particular flight leg where seat selection is available.
Client provides each stage individually after reading corresponding seat availability information from availableSeats output.

SelectedSeatsStage.description: Seat selection stage. Corresponds to a particular flight leg.

seatIds.description:
An array of seatId selected per each passenger.
Order must match the order of passengers array.

AvailableSeats.description:
An array with seat availability stages. Each stage corresponds to a particular flight leg where seat selection is available.
Each stage is emitted separately when automation reaches corresponding seat selection screen.

AvailableSeatsStage.description: Seat availability information for each seat selection stage.

leg.description: Flight leg name as displayed on website. Example: "LTN to ZRH, Wed 7th Mar"

seatId.description: Seat number as extracted from website. Example: "07A"

available.description: true if website allows selecting this seat, false otherwise

price.description: Seat price, if such information is available.

bookingReference.description: Booking reference grabbed from the page.

price.description: Price, if found on the successful booking page.
